com.apigee.flow.execution

Interface Callback


  • public interface Callback

    Callback for a Runnable task. You can use Callback to implement certain asynchronous patterns. Such patterns are used for cases like submitting metrics to an analytics server or logging. Generally, consider an asynchronous pattern for time-consuming Execution operations that do not influence or interact with the proxy flow in any way.

    Note: It is important that the submitted tasks do not hold any reference to the message context or to the execution context. If the task is long running, it might lead to out of memory conditions and it is also possible that while the task is running, the message flow has already completed.

    Example: Submit a task and call a callback when the task completes

    public class SubmitTaskAndContinueCallbackHandling implements Execution {

    private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger("SubmitTaskAndContinueCallbackHandling");

    public ExecutionResult execute(final MessageContext messageContext, final ExecutionContext executionContext) {
        executionContext.submitTask(new Task(), new CallbackTask(), "handback");
        return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS;
    }

    private static class Task implements Runnable {

        public void run() {
            // Perform task unrelated to the proxy flow, such as sending data to 
            // an analytics server. 
        }
    }

    private static class CallbackTask implements Callback {

        public void callback(Runnable task, Object handback) {
            // Log completion results
        }
    }
}

     

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void callback(java.lang.Runnable task, java.lang.Object handback) 
      A callback that is called when a submitted runnable task completes.

    • Method Detail

      • callback

        void callback(java.lang.Runnable task,
              java.lang.Object handback)
        Gets a named flow variable from the proxy flow in Edge.
        Parameters:
        task - A runnable.
        handback - An object that can be used to pass message or execution context to the callback.
